result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L. Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert L. Jones was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; credit for 1 day served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 11/6/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states she was unable to meet deft yet, has appointment for next week; stipulates to amending the information to remove the Sr suffix from deft's name.  FPT continued to 10/14/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.addlTxt: File sent to Br 3 for substs.

Defendant, Robert L. Jones, appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Caption and DE's name corrected from Sr. to Jr. DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
